name: strand-calendar
description: A simple calendar rendering component. Intended for use in strand-datepicker but can be used for standalone date selection. Note: strand-calendar makes heavy use of moment.js

attributes.name: date
attributes.description: The date object for the selected calendar date.

attributes.name: pairDate
attributes.description: A secondary date object used to denote selection range. For use in a dual strand-datepicker scenario (see: strand-datepicker).

attributes.name: viewDate
attributes.description: Sets the cleandar month, if not specified will default the current month. When cycling through months, the viewDate will represent the month currently displayed.

attributes.name: useTapSelect
attributes.description: Sets a default tap handler that selects the current date. Generally only set to false for cases where a custom selection behavior is desired

attributes.name: disableFuture
attributes.description: If true, sets the visual display and interaction state of all dates following the current date to inactive. If a date object is passed, it will set all dates following the specified date to inactive.

attributes.name: disablePast
attributes.description: If true, sets the visual display and interaction state of all dates preceeding the current date to inactive. If a date object is passed, it will set all dates preceeding the specified date to inactive.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Sets the visual and interaction state to be disabled.

detail.name: date
detail.description: The date object for the selected date.

detail.name: target
detail.description: The dom node which triggered the calendar selection.

detail.name: unix
detail.description: The unix timestamp (in seconds, not milliseconds) for the selected date.
